title: Peer Assessment-Based STEM Project Design and Implementation

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Mobile device utilization per learner, integrated with peer evaluation systems and feedback tools

learning_goals: Learners can apply a rubric with 80% accuracy across three or more peer evaluation rounds.
Learners complete two or more collaborative problem-solving projects in STEM fields, achieving an average team contribution score of 4.0/5.0 or higher.

Learners develop a solution prototype integrating scientific modeling (traffic flow simulation), data analysis (real-time traffic volume processing), and engineering design (signal system optimization) for a community traffic congestion problem over two weeks and submit a report meeting four or more of five evaluation criteria (creativity, feasibility, data utilization, etc.).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
